question: Near a pedestrian crossing, when the pedestrians are waiting to cross the road, you should-

options.2: Slow down, sound horn and pass.
options.3: Stop the vehicle and wait till the pedestrians cross the road and then proceed.

question: You are approaching a narrow bridge, another vehicle is about to enter the bridge from opposite side, you should-

options.1: Increase the speed and try to cross the bridge as fast as possible.
options.2: Put on the headlight and pass the bridge.
options.3: Wait till the other vehicle crosses the bridge and then proceed.

options.2: There is no road to left.

question: When a vehicle involved in an accident causing injury to any person

options.1: Take the vehicle to the nearest police stattion and report the accident.
options.2: Stop the vehicle and report to the police station.
options.3: Take all reasonable steps to secure medical attention to the injured and report to the nearest police station within 24 hours.

question: On a road designated as one way

options.3: Should not drive in reverse gear.

question: You can overtake a vehicle in front

options.1: Through the right side of the vehicle.
options.3: Through the left side, if the road is wide.

question: When a vehicle approaches unguarded railway

options.1: Stop the vehicle on the left side of the road, get down from the vehicle, go to the railway track, and ensure that no train or trolley is coming from either side.
options.2: Sound horn and cross the track as fast as possible.
